item.title: Languages
item.description: See Also Minikin Proto-Morellic Sarvaran Sarvaran Poetry Stonechild Imperial Modern Morellic Proto-Snixian Demi-Slug Proto-Kpavan

item.title: Proto-Kpavan
item.description: Proto-Kpavan was spoken in 6,000YA by the equatorial Demi-Slug peoples. Phonology Consonants Consonants Labial Alveolar Palatal Velar Glottal Nasal m m̩ n n̩ ŋ ŋ̩ Plosive p b t d k g k͡p g͡b ʔ Fricative f s x Approx.

item.title: Proto-Morellic
item.description: Proto-Morellic was spoken in 8,000 YA by the Morellic Minikin, in the 2nd Realm’s Etavi Peninsula. Phonology Consonants Consonants Labial Coronal Dorsal Laryngeal Plosive p b bʱ t d dʱ k g gʱ Fricative f v s z x ɣ h Sonorant m mʱ n nʱ l ŋ ŋʱ Vowels Vowels Front Central Back High i u Mid e o Low ä

item.title: Proto-Neth
item.description: Proto-Neth was spoken in 7,000YA by the Neth Minikin. Grammar Word Order Proto-Neth word order was generally free, but the verb almost always stayed in between the subject and object.

item.title: Proto-Rotanythi
item.description: Consonants Labial Coronal Dorsal Plosive p, b, pʰ (ph) t, d, tʰ (th) k, g, kʰ (kh) Fricative f, v s, z x (h) Nasal m n Sonorant l, r, j (y) Vowels Front Central Back High i u Mid e ə (y) o Low a Consonants Labial Coronal Retroflex Dorsal Plosive p, b, pː (pp) t, d, tː (tt) ʈ͡ʂ (tr), ɖ͡ʐ (dr), ʈ͡ʂː (ttr) k, g, kː (kk) Fricative f, v s, z ʂ (sr), ʐ (zr) x Nasal m n Sonorant l, r Vowels Front Central Back High i u Mid e o Low a

item.title: Proto-Snixian
item.description: Proto-Snixian was spoken in 8,500YA by the Proto-Snixian Minikin. It acted as the progenitor of the Snixian Languages. Phonology Syllable Structure (C)V(C)

item.title: Sarvaran
item.description: Sarvaran was spoken in 6,500YA1 in the Sarvaran Civilisation by Minikin. It descended from Proto-Morellic and so is part of the Morellic Language Family.

item.title: Stonechild Imperial
item.description: Stonechild Imperial was spoken in the Empire of the Petrified Child by Minikin. It descended from Sarvaran and so is part of the Morellic Language Family.
